title: Configure cloud tags
content:
You can assign labels known as tags to cloud resources in AWS, Azure, and OCI. Tags provide an easy way to logically organize cloud resources based on purpose, owner, environment, or other criteria. You can use tags to filter, search, and manage cloud resources. If your organization uses tags, it's possible to configure and reference them to filter reports.

You can configure the tags to use in report filters when you first create a cost reporting integration or later, by updating the tags of an existing integration. The configuration process is the same in each case.

Note the following points when working with tags:

  • Tag limitations 
    The number of tags that are collected with billing data is limited to 30 for AWS and Azure. 
  • Tag persistence 
    Tags are shared across all cost reporting integrations for a specific provider type. Once created, tag definitions persist separately from integrations. This is useful in scenarios such as testing, where you may change the source of billing data but wish to verify the existence of tags in different environments (for example, Development versus Staging).
  • Data collection implications
    Configured tags are fetched along with billing data. Any modification of tags from a cost reporting integration triggers a full data collection, for all integrations configured for that cloud provider, during the next data collection cycle. This may result in a longer-than-usual data collection time.
    Note that if you start the data collection manually and have more than one integration on the same tenant, you must wait for the first billing data collection to complete successfully before you start the collection on all remaining integrations. For help troubleshooting a data collection issue associated with tags, see Billing data collection fails after you update an integration's tags.
  • Tag prerequisites
    Tags must exist in the cloud provider before you can use them in reports. For AWS, cost allocation tags must already be in an Active state.

View configured tags

From Administration > Providers > Cloud Cost Data Providers, select a cost reporting integration from the list. The name and key of all the tags configured for this integration are displayed on the left pane under Tags.

Any modification of tags from a cost reporting integration triggers a full data collection, for all integrations configured for that cloud provider, during the next data collection cycle. This may result in a longer-than-usual data collection time, and will cause issues if the collection is still running when the next scheduled collection is due to start.

To avoid this issue, we strongly recommend that you manually trigger data collection any time that you modify cloud tags, and then disable the integration until the full data collection is complete. You can then enable the integration again to resume scheduled data collection. To do this, click the play icon to start the data collection, and then click the toggle switch under COLLECTION SETTINGS so that it says Collection is disabled. When the full data collection is complete, click the toggle switch again so that it says Collection is enabled.

Add tags

  1. Click Administration > Providers > Cloud Cost Data Providers, and then select a cost reporting integration from the list.
  2. On the left pane, you can view the tags applied to the selected integration. Select Edit Tags below the tags list.
  3. From the Edit Cloud Tags screen, select New Tag.
  4. Specify a name and key value for the tag.
  5. Click Save.

Edit tags

  1. Click Administration > Providers > Cloud Cost Data Providers, and then select a cost reporting integration from the list.
  2. On the left pane, you can view the tags applied to the selected integration. Select Edit Tags below the tags list.
  3. You will find all the tags applied to the selected resource on the Edit Cloud Tags screen. Modify the name or value of the tags from this screen.
  4. Click Save.

Delete tags

  1. Click Administration > Providers > Cloud Cost Data Providers, and then select a cost reporting integration from the list.
  2. On the left pane, you can view the tags applied to the selected integration. Select Edit Tags below the tags list. 
  3. Click the delete button beside the tag you want to delete.
  4. Click Save.
